text:
Draught @ Canalhouse, 48-52 Canal Street, Nottingham, Nottinghamshire, England NG1 7EH. [ As Cloudwater Summer Range - US Hopfen Weisse ].Unclear matt medium yellow orange color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, moderate hoppy, citrus, orange - citrus, moderate yeasty, weizen yeast, banana. Flavor is moderate to light heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, dry, hoppy, citrus - orange, banana, weizen yeast. Body is medium, texture is creamy - watery, carbonation is soft. [20151007]
 7-3-8-3-15
Bottle from CC. Hazy color , Some citrus in aroma. A bit to bitter taste for me
Pours hazy light golden colour with an off white head. Citrus nose. Has a bitter taste to start but a little wheaty in the middle but a slight bitterness on the finish which isnt quite to my taste.
Really clean, sharp tasting weisse, lots of tropical ipa style hops, very clean tasting.
Bottle from Favourite Beer, Cheltenham. Hazy golden colour with a thin white head. Nice fresh citrus and grainy aroma. Taste is citrus bittersweet.

Aroma: yeast, grain and bread malts, light banana, floral hops. Appearance: hazy, pale gold, massive, creamy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters continue, intensify, sweet fruits appearing, mango, sweet orange, bitter finish. Overall: very nice German Hefeweizen, fantastic aroma and palate. Bottle from the brewery, Manchester.
caramel and grapefruit aromas, hazy amber gold body with a foamy white head, amazing tropical fruitiness with a lingering refreshing finish

Bottle at home pciked up by Sarah from Bottle:Shop St Albans. Translucent pale golden coloured pour with a lasting white frothy head. Effervescent. Aroma is nice, mix of pollen, floral hop, passion fruit and citrus with edges of earthy straw and tangy wheat grains. Flavour is composed of Rustic wheaty grains, strain, floral citrus hop, little zesty, with background tropical notes. Palate is slightly creamy dought grains, highish carbonation.Good hoppy hefe.
Draft. Cloudy golden color, white head. Bright bubblegum aroma. Taste is slightly sour grapefruit bubblegum. Not sure why the US is in the name, this tastes German to me!

Bottle from The Bottle Shop London. Cloudy gold lasting cream head. new world hops over old world weizen aroma. Grapefruit esters banana. Interesting beer. Hops are intense but not over the top the base beer is decent. Bitter on finish. Yep I like it.
Do I detect all those New World hops over the pond? Not necessarily. Its still a balanced beer, and so refreshing. Lovely.

Keg @ Craven Arms, Birmingham - MTB event. Pours hazy orange with foamy white head. Good hefe esters in the aroma. Taste is big and full-flavoured with bright bubblegum and banana alongside fresh orange zest and lovely subtle creaminess. Very nice this.
bottle from beer hawk not for me this one nice golden colour bitter on the taste
Pleasant session drink with subtle Weiss character. Beautiful packaging too!

Keg at The Piccadilly Tap, Manchester. A cloudy golden orange colour with a fluffy white head. Aroma of lemon, peach, some pineapple, banana, slight wheat and subtle caramel. Taste of lemon, peach, some banana, subtle clove, wheat, subtle orange peel, a little bubblegum and caramel. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A dryish, wheaty, lemony finish. A well hopped Hefeweizen that is quite experimental, what I expect from Cloudwater. Something different and the best Ive tried outside Germany.

Keg (Pint Shop, Cambridge)
Delicious citrussy hop aroma, tons of vanilla creaminess from the wheat. Pale cloudy orange, small tight head. Wow! I have just had a spooky out-of-body experience from the taste and sensation. For a brief moment I was transported to another plane. I was no longer in the pub, no longer hearing the noise of the customers and their glasses, it was just me, and this beer, and it was wonderful. Full palate, but refreshing too. Creamy light wheaty grains in the taste, but beatiful fruity hops. Utterly magical wheat beer. Wow! (Comments previously made about UK brewers and wheat beers do not apply here, obviously.)

Bottle share at Leightons. Hazy dark yellow, opaque, lightly sparkling, big foamy white head, full lacing. Aroma is straw, oniony, rubber, dried hop flowers. Body is light, tingly carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is pithy orange, waxy lime, wheaty, some dry medicinal notes. Pretty nice.

Bottle split at LKS, thanks to Danny, 03/09/15.
Hazed golden with a moderate off White covering. 
Nose is apricot jam, light yeast, grassy, punchy tropical notes.
Taste comprises tangerine, straw, bitter orange, apricot, light bread dough. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a juicy hop wash. 
Decent hoppy weisse.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 3rd September 2015Bottle share at Mr Smiths Stratoflat. Thanks to Dan. Hazy gold beer, decent pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry. Decent fine carbonation. Nice orange and orange pith. Light touch of tinned mango. Mild floral lemon. Light semi dry finish brings a trace of vanilla cream. Nice!

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Daniel. Pours hazy yellow-gold with a dense, frothy white head. Fresh and vibrant aroma, some yeast, citrus fruits, melon. Light to medium sweet flavor, some bitter grass, hay, rindy citrus, tangerine, melon, grapefruit. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Finishes with some dry wheat bread, citrus fruits, more tangerine pithy lemon and grapefruit, grass. Nice stuff.

Bottle thanks to Dan. It pours cloudy deep golden with a small white head. The nose is fresh, juicy, creamy, smoked sausage, chair latte, wheat, orange and lime. The taste is soft, juicy doughy, wheaten bread, peach, orange peel, apricot and light spice with a dry, citrusy finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Not bad.
Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Clove, pine, grapefruit, tropical fruit aromas. Taste is pine, grapefruit, banana, clove, slight bubblegum. Nice dry finish. Very good.
330ml bottle from Good Spirits Co. Hazy yellow amber, big foamy head. Wheat hop clove aroma. Wheat banana hop flavour. Sharp hoppy clove aftertaste. One of the best Hefeweizens I have ever had.

Straw coloured, hazy with a small but thick white head and some sticky lacing. Medium body with a hint of wheat texture; more fizzy than foamy. Lots of fruity hop flavour - lightly spiced - with lemon, pineapple and a touch of orange. A fun, drinkable beer.

Bottle. Hop Hideout, Sheffield. Cloudy, pale orange. A few messy bubbles of white head. Sweet, chewy, banana toffee malts. Fruity, peachy, ripe orange hop. Bit of creamed coconut to it. If I didnt know otherwise, Id have said theres Sorachi in this. Anyhow, taste is pithy, punchy bitter. Soft, creamy sweetness. Turns pretty dry. Smooth palate. Finishes crisp, clean bitter, with that creamy sweetness hanging on.
Keg at St Albans Beer shop, St Albans, Herts. A hazy golden/yellow coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Wheaty, fruity, yeasty aroma. Tastes wheaty, fruity, yeasty, spice. Pretty good.
Bottle from Cornelius. Hazy light yellow gold, white head. Elderflower and preserved lemon nose. Medium light body, sweet soft fizz. Yeast and busy citrus. Shortish bitter finish. Good.

Pours a cloudy orange-ish yellow colour with a huge white head which largely remains. Aroma is wheat, coriander and an assortment of other various herbs Taste is orange peel, slight grapefruit, herbs, zingy lemon, slight basil and some soda bread. Moderate tartness throughout.

Bottle (5.2% ABV) from Cork & Cask. Hazy orange body with a thick off-white head. Good lacing. Aroma of flower petals, bergamot, foam bananas and lime chutney. Flavour of soft malts, tangy orange, floral hops, melon and a peppery finish. Medium body with a creamy texture. Light fizz. Soft and fruity - really nice.
Keg at the hanging bat. Pours hazy yellow, nose is fruity, pineapple, light funk, taste is juicy pine, melon, dry, bitter.
Keg at the hanging bat... Hazy amber... Thin white lacing.. Soft massive banana fruit nose... Soft sweet fruits.. Light spiced banana... Little too fizzy
Summer 2015. 5.5% keg at the hanging bat. Pours hazy pale gold, thin white head. Citrus aromas dominate, some sweet malt notes. Taste has spicy yeast, bag more citrus, bitter finish.
